title: NO POTTING UP METHOD FOR TOMATO SEEDLINGS  - One Cup Method for Huge Tomatoes

subtasks: Gather necessary materials (solo cups, seed starting mix, tray with rim, seeds, vermiculite)
Drill drainage holes in solo cups
Moisturize seed starting mix ahead of time
Fill solo cups halfway with moistened seed starting mix and pack down
Plant 2-3 seeds on surface, cover with quarter inch of soil and vermiculite
Water by adding 2-3 inches of water to the tray, allowing excess to drain
Use grow lights for sprouting and initial growth
After 4-6 weeks, trim leaves below the cup's rim
Pot up by adding potting soil to fill cups, covering stem roots
Move plants to a sunny location (garage or greenhouse) for hardening off
Gradually acclimate plants to outdoor conditions over 7-10 days
Transplant tomato seedlings into garden bed
